data.title: Is it better to use uniformly or normally distributed random numbers for a Monte Carlo simulation?
data.meta_description:
Answer (1 of 2): Monte Carlo and simulation are two different technique. Neither uniform nor Normal distributions are commonly useful, except that you often start with uniform pseudorandom variates (because theyâ€™re widely available and simple) and transform them into what you want.
